result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Riley Q Ludack

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Riley Q Ludack in court.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Riley Q Ludack. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CF130, 22FO391, 22TR2284, 22TR2285

State - deft will enter into 12 month DAGP on Ct 1 of 22CF130 - dismiss 22TR2284, 22TR2285, 22FO391, needs waiver of prelim
Atty Lundeen - agrees that is the agreement
Court - speaks to deft's right to preliminary hearing
Deft - waives preliminary hearing
Court - finds probable cause and binds deft over for trial

Court - reads charges and max penalties
Deft - enters a no contest plea to Ct 1, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Does not accept no contest plea to Ct 1 today and approves DAGP, schedules review date 

Dismissed: 22TR2284, 22TR2285, 22FO391
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on June 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Order for Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea
not be in the presence of drug paraphernalia or controlled substances without a valid prescription
